chapter.p: 1The vision of Isaiah son of Amoz, which he saw concerning Judah and Jerusalem in the days of Uzziah, Jotham, Ahaz, and Hezekiah, kings of Judah.

ul.li1: 2Hear, heavens,
ul.li2: and listen, earth,
ul.li1: “I reared children
ul.li2: and I brought them up,
ul.li1: 3An ox knows its owner
ul.li2: and a donkey the manger of its master.
ul.li1: Israel does not know;
ul.li2: my people do not understand.
ul.li1: 4Ah, sinful nation,
ul.li2: a people heavy with iniquity,
ul.li1: offspring of evildoers,
ul.li2: children who deal corruptly.
ul.li1: They have forsaken Yahweh;
ul.li2: they have despised the holy one of Israel.
ul.li3: They are estranged and gone backward.
ul.li1: 5Why do you want to be beaten again?
ul.li2: You continue in rebellion.
ul.li1: The whole of the head is sick,
ul.li2: and the whole of the heart is faint.
ul.li1: 6From the sole of the foot and up to the head
ul.li2: there is no health in it;
ul.li1: bruise and sore and bleeding wound have not been cleansed,
ul.li2: and they have not been bound up
and not softened with the oil.
ul.li1: 7Your country is desolate,
ul.li2: your cities are burned with fire;
ul.li1: As for your land, aliens are devouring it in your presence,
ul.li2: and it is desolate, like devastation by foreigners.
ul.li1: 8And the daughter of Zion is left like a booth in a vineyard,
ul.li2: like a shelter in a cucumber field,
like a city that is besieged.Or “preserved”
ul.li1: 9If Yahweh of hosts had not left us survivors,Hebrew “survivor”
ul.li2: we would have been as few as Sodom,
we would have become like Gomorrah.
ul.li1: 10Hear the word of Yahweh, rulers of Sodom!
ul.li2: Listen to the teaching of our God, people of Gomorrah!
ul.li1: 11What is the abundance of your sacrifices to me? says Yahweh.
ul.li2: I have had enough of burnt offerings of rams
ul.li3: and the fat of fattened animals
ul.li2: and I do not delight in the blood of bulls
ul.li1: 12When you come to appear before me,
ul.li2: who asked for this from your hand:
you trampling my courts?
ul.li1: 13You must not continueLiterally “increase” or “add to” to bring offeringsHebrew “offering” of futility,
ul.li2: incense—it is an abomination to me;
ul.li1: new moon and Sabbath, the calling of a convocation—
ul.li2: I cannot endure iniquity with solemn assembly.
ul.li1: 14Your new moons and your appointed festivals my soul hates;
ul.li2: they have become to me like a burden,
I am not able to bear them.
ul.li1: 15And when you stretch out your hands,
ul.li2: I will hide my eyes from you;
ul.li1: even though you make many prayers,Hebrew “prayer”
ul.li2: I will not be listening.
ul.li1: Your hands are full of blood. 16Wash! Make yourselves clean!
ul.li2: Remove the evil of your doings from before my eyes!
ul.li1: Cease to do evil! 17Learn to do good!
ul.li2: Seek justice! Rescue the oppressed!
Defend the orphan! Plead for the widow!
ul.li1: 18“Come now, and let us argue,” says Yahweh.
ul.li2: “Even though your sins are like scarlet, they will be white like snow;
even though they are red like crimson, they shall become like wool.
ul.li1: 19If you are willing and you are obedient,
ul.li2: you shall eat the good of the land.
ul.li1: 20But if you refuse and you rebel, you shall be devoured by the sword.

chapter.p: For the mouth of Yahweh has spoken.”

ul.li1: 21How has a faithful city become like a whore?
ul.li2: Full of justice, righteousness lodged in her, but now murderers.
ul.li1: 22Your silver has become as dross;
ul.li2: Your wine is diluted with waters.
ul.li1: 23Your princes are rebels
ul.li2: and companions of thieves.
ul.li1: Every one loves a bribe
ul.li2: and runs after gifts.
ul.li1: They do not defend the orphan
ul.li2: and the legal dispute of the widow does not come before them.
ul.li1: 24Therefore, the declaration of the Lord Yahweh of hosts, the Mighty One of Israel:
“Ah, I will be relieved of my enemies,
ul.li2: and I will avenge myself on my foes.
ul.li1: 25And I will turn my hand against you;
I will purify your dross like lye,
ul.li2: and I will remove all of your tin.
ul.li1: 26And I will restore your judges, as at the first,
ul.li2: and your counselors, as at the beginning.
ul.li1: After this you will be calledLiterally “it will be called for you” the city of righteousness,
ul.li2: faithful city.
ul.li1: 27Zion will be redeemed by justice,
ul.li2: and those of her who repent, by righteousness.
ul.li1: 28But the destruction of rebels and sinners shall be together,
ul.li2: and those who forsake Yahweh will perish.
ul.li1: 29For youLiterally “they,” but a few manuscripts read “you,” which fits the context better will be ashamed of the oaks in which you delighted,
ul.li2: and you will be disgraced because of the gardens that you have chosen.
ul.li1: 30For you shall be like an oak withering its leaves,
ul.li2: and like a garden where there is no water for her.
ul.li1: 31And the strong man shall become like tinder,
ul.li2: and his work like a spark.
ul.li1: And both of them shall burn together,
ul.li2: and there is not one to quench them.”
